{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3590561,"name":"Prince M","username":"CrypticXSystem","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crypticxsystem/{size}/217431_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T06:49:08.230Z","cooked":"

The idea is that alliances have transmitters (or use the already existing radios) on their robots and they can communicate to each other during a match. A possible use case could be transmitting your robots Pose data to the rest of your alliance which can possibly be used in algorithms like pathfinding to dodge alliance robots. Or even near the end of a match instead of screaming what your robot is going to do (Climbing, parking etc) you can simply transmit it and your alliance can have code that behaves accordingly.

Even if this is not legal now, would FRC possibly be open to making it legal in the future? Or even standardizing robot-to-robot communication like this?

Personally I think this will only benefit the overall competitiveness of FRC.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T06:49:08.230Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":750,"readers_count":749,"score":254.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Prince M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64623,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Theoretical Computer Science Enthusiast"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590566,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T07:09:03.835Z","cooked":"

R707 is what would currently prevent this.

That said, in a hypothetical future where inter-robot communication was allowed, I would suggest against using a separate transmitter/receiver system and just use the existing wireless network. Currently, each team’s network (wireless from field to robot and wired from DS to field) is segmented apart by VLANs. There’s nothing saying FIRST can’t open up some form of communication across VLANs. Perhaps open a single port between VLANs for the same alliance and build something into WPILib to enable communication/data sharing over that port.

The biggest problem with doing something like this is that it requires teams communicate and agree on a data format. For it to work, it would need to be standardized in some way, which is why I suggest it be built into WPILib and just toggled on/off depending on team preference. Teams can be given control over what types of data should be shared and perhaps the source of those values, but the data structures should be standardized.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T07:10:01.323Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":737,"readers_count":736,"score":262.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R707","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R707 | FRCTools","clicks":67}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590570,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T07:33:00.271Z","cooked":"
Fletch1373:

R707 is what would currently prevent this.

Actually, I think it’s possible to work around R707 and R706 by using the field radios, and a little bit of what I’ll call “creativity” with the Operator Console, particularly in programming of same, and a wee bit of standardization.

It’s R904.A that’s most likely to cause issues with that workaround, in case you’re wondering. And I really, really don’t want to be the CSA/FTA/HR type at the first event someone tries something like what I’m thinking would be legal…Because then I’d need to be talking to HQ with “I need all the help I can get” sort of discussion.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T07:33:00.271Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":620,"readers_count":619,"score":178.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R904","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R904 | FRCTools","clicks":49}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590574,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T07:54:49.126Z","cooked":"

I dont see how R904 (Operator console size/shape/etc) comes into play here. R706/R707 clearly prohibit any form of network traffic except what we’re accustomed to (DS<->Robot via Field AP).

If youre considering something but dont want to share it publicly, feel free to DM me. I’m definitely curious, because I don’t see any options given the current rules.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T07:54:49.126Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":519,"readers_count":518,"score":118.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590605,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T10:53:11.168Z","cooked":"

R706/R707 only prohibit wireless communication.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T10:53:11.168Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":443,"readers_count":442,"score":218.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590610,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T11:34:55.876Z","cooked":"

Drive station with a seperate local lan switch and provide your alliance mates with a second Ethernet adapter for their PC. Isolate it to a specific subnet that won’t interfere with your robot network or regular Ethernet adapter that DS uses. Even better connect with DS first to FMS then do your local lan party connection (don’t slow down the field, so be on the ball with setup and get started ASAP)

You can then communicate to each other, share robot data, etc but go from robot to drive station to drive station to robot.

Avoids wireless all together and you’ll have much better bandwidth/control instead of sending it through the field network infrastructure as well.

Even better R706 has nothing to do with communication from operator console to operator console. It’s specific to comms going to and from the robot and the path that follows.

R706 *Don’t bypass the ARENA network. All signals must originate from the OPERATOR CONSOLE and be transmitted to the ROBOT via the ARENA Ethernet network.

If each operator console is responsible for controlling its own robot legally through the arena network and is listening on a second local network for some echoed telemetry data that seems legal.

Edit: on a seperate note you could also potentially tether between robots and talk directly… But unless it’s a game like 2015 expect the opposing alliance to try and rip the wire out, or run into issues with the tether being considered outside of the starting configuration/extension limits.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T12:37:17.892Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":423,"readers_count":422,"score":94.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":6,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590625,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T12:24:32.044Z","cooked":"

I have always thought there would be significant potential in having an alliance access level of NT and further a general access level. This could use the same infrastructure and be wireless while not transmitting anything through other channels.

The biggest thing with all of this is that you need a significant number of teams to adhere to standards in order for the system to be useful.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T12:36:10.381Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":326,"readers_count":325,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590664,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T13:55:07.286Z","cooked":"

In quals, you need a significant number for it to be useful. In elims, there could be value for just 3 (or even 2) to adopt.

R706 *Don’t bypass the ARENA network. All signals must originate from the OPERATOR CONSOLE and be transmitted to the ROBOT via the ARENA Ethernet network.

R706 has nothing to do with wireless communication.

kingc95:

Even better R706 has nothing to do with communication from operator console to operator console. It’s specific to comms going to and from the robot and the path that follows

I actually read it tbe other way. It mentions “All signals” not “all wireless” or even “all robot communication”.

Surely you agree that two drive coaches could talk to each other during a match without violating R706, though.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T14:00:49.096Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":55.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590689,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T14:28:19.597Z","cooked":"

Depends on the definitions of “signal” and “originate”. The signal (eg packet) to the ROBOT still “originates” in its respective DS, we just generate that signal based on other information than a human input. I think everyone would agree that sending a camera stream from the robot to the DS, doing image processing on the DS side, and sending a signal to the robot based on that is legal (outside of the G402 restriction).

Another possibility to consider is using the visual spectrum—have one DS show a QR code to another DS’s camera, for example. Although interestingly R905 doesn’t specifically mention vision as an exception, only motion control via a Kinect—so maybe one DS waving a flag and the other using a Kinect to detect it? In past years, DS vision of the field generating info to the robot was legal (254 did it in Power Up), so not sure if that was intentionally changed.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T14:30:44.855Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":233,"readers_count":232,"score":61.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590691,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T14:30:04.113Z","cooked":"

Well yes, I agree if we’re talking specifically the letter of the law, that yes thats technically an exception. However, given the title of the rule, “Don’t bypass the ARENA network”, I’d say it’s safe to assume we’re talking electrical signals here.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T14:30:04.113Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590720,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T15:16:20.088Z","cooked":"

If we asked the QA would they be able to provide a useful answer or we’ll get a ‘We can’t provide input on a hypothetical concept’ type answer.

I’d like to know where the line is drawn. If I have an IP camera looking at the drivers and that image is processed on the DS and used to control the robot, the laptop is being networked to a separate camera outside of the arenas control, could even be on a seperate subnet. I can accomplish the same with a drive station laptop webcam or a plug in USB. As long as any signals sent to the robot only come through the Driver Station and official protocols why would that be illegal?

Again to me the arena is not supposed to be in the loop for everything, you can have external programs on your computer that will work for custom controller boards from an Arduino, processing the data over serial or as a direct HID keyboard and remapping it as joystick buttons. If I want to do that same thing with a hard-line Ethernet and use TCP/IP based protocols why is that any different? The Arena is not involved or needed for this and would add additional lag to any processing time.

kingc95:

Drive station with a seperate local lan switch and provide your alliance mates with a second Ethernet adapter for their PC.

Fletch1373:

I dont see how R904 (Operator console size/shape/etc) comes into play here.

Who’s operator console is the switch and associated cabling a part of, and how does that affect the size of their operator console?

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-13T19:07:03.262Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":52.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499097,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-have-robot-to-robot-communication","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Ryan_Blue","name":"Ryan Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3590951,"name":"Daniel G","username":"danielg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/danielg/{size}/226404_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-13T19:16:37.050Z","cooked":"

Actually for R904, since OPERATOR CONSOLE is defined as “the set of COMPONENTS and MECHANISMS used by the DRIVERS and/or HUMAN PLAYERS to relay commands to the ROBOT”, I would ask whether the neighboring “operator console” (common sense definition) with which a team’s “operator console” is communicating becomes a part of that team’s defined OPERATOR CONSOLE. Surely the drivers are using information it produces to control the robot. In the same way, a screen showing a dashboard is part of the OPERATOR CONSOLE because the drivers are using it.

Granted, this is an expansive definition of “use” - a more restricted definition would contain only COMPONENTS and MECHANISMS that are specifically for the purpose of commanding the robot, like the driver’s laptop. But “use” probably contains “use indirectly”, and I’d rather not be the one trying to argue otherwise to a ref. (This still seems silly. Is the tray on which the laptop sits being “used”?)

However…

Peter_Johnson:

So if the drivers on both teams hold onto the Ethernet cable?

so the drivers on both teams need only hold each others’ computing devices used to send the communication as well!

Wait… that only saves you from R904B (depth) not R904A (length). Ah well.

This begs the question, if I projected a hologram that showed information to the drivers that extended more than 6 feet and 6 inches off the ground, surely that would be allowed? Can a COMPONENT be intangible?

I don’t want to hijack the thread but I think the next logical step that FIRST could take is to have the robots on an alliance all be able to publish information to each other. I think there could be some standards developed for message contents & formatting (robot pose, robot velocities, maybe even some way for the robots to communicate planned pathway, …).

I don’t think this would add to the capabilities of robots in the 1st year that such things were implemented but over 2 or 3 years, I suppose you’ll see tons of really cool behaviors that are not possible today.
